plugins.name: XAuto
plugins.description:
Auto Layout Presets:


  • Horizontal
  • Vertical
  • Stretch Horizontal
  • Stretch Vertical
  • Space Between Horizontal
  • Space Between Vertical
  • Toggle Direction


All presets are available as plugin parameters and individual menu items so you can create shortcuts that suit you.


Frame Alignment


Change your frame alignment quick as a flash by assigning custom short cuts rather than using the standard Figma UI.


If you have a full size keyboard try assigning Cmd + Option and the numbers on the numpad.


Padding and Spacing Panel


Try assigning a shortcut like `Ctrl + Shift + A` to quickly access frame padding and spacing options.


How To Use Presets


  1. Select the items you want to apply a preset to. If the items are not already in a frame, XAuto will create a parent frame for you.
  2. Apply preset via the plugin parameters or menu
  3. Profit


Playground


After installing the XAuto plugin I highly recommend downloading the XAuto Playground community file and try it out.

plugins.name: Fontfinder
plugins.description: Fontfinder is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers effortlessly identify and count all the unique fonts used within any selected artboard. Whether you're working on a single frame or an entire design system, Fontfinder ensures that you can quickly get a comprehensive list of fonts, making typography management simpler and more organized. This plugin is perfect for ensuring font consistency across your design projects while saving time on font audits.

plugins.description:
Knice Slice provides a precise and accurate means of determining the minimal repeating dimensions of a selected object, which can then be optimized for use in the Unity platform. This tool is a valuable asset for those seeking to ensure that their Unity projects are finely tuned and optimized for optimal performance.


Select a rectangle or flattened vector and run!



This function is limited to rectangle and vector objects only.
plugins.tagline: Knice slice provides the smallest repeatable dimensions of the selected object to be used in Unity.

This plugin automatically converts fonts in Text layers to Korean characters in Apple SD Gothic and English letters, numbers, and special characters in SF Pro, similar to the Korean iOS system fonts. Additionally, SF Pro is configured to detect the font size and automatically apply the unique letter spacing values characteristic of iOS.

plugins.name: Artwork Flow Brand Assistant
plugins.description:
About Artwork Flow

Artwork Flow is an intelligent creative operations platform that allows designers, marketing teams, and brands to create, store, manage, and publish data-backed creatives at scale within minutes. Using Artwork Flow, businesses can maximize their campaign ROI with accelerated creative production, streamlined tasks and workflows, actionable creative insights, an intuitive asset library, and automated brand compliance.


Why choose Artwork Flowâ€™s Brand Assistant on Figma?

Artwork Flow allows brands to store their brand guidelines, elements, and other assets on a smart digital asset management system while helping users streamline their creative operations with flexible workflows.

With Artwork Flowâ€™s Brand Assistant, you can import any assets stored on Artwork Flow, including images and brand assets like logos, colours, and fonts. You can also complete any pending upload tasks on Artwork Flow by uploading assets directly from Figma.


To get started with Artwork Flow:

  1. Sign up for Artwork Flow: https://bit.ly/AFxFigma
  2. Upload your brand guidelines and assets to Artwork Flow.
  3. Install Brand Assistant on Figma and simplify your creative operations.
plugins.tagline: Access all your brand assets on Artwork Flow and update your tasks through Figma.

===


ðŸ”Œ What kind of plugin is it?


Feedback Flow is a plugin that allows you to create a to-do list while reviewing comments on Figma.


When working on design with multiple people, you might find yourself exchanging information through comments. I'm sure everyone has experienced scenarios where they've had to make adjustments requested in comments, haven't they?

In such situations, this plugin allows you to create to-dos from these comments.

First, write down the to-dos from the comments, then proceed with making the required adjustments while viewing the to-do list. This way, you can ensure that no tasks are overlooked.



ðŸ”§ How to use


When you select 'Add to Task' from a comment, that comment gets added to your tasks. Within the task list, you can manage the status of tasks as completed or incomplete, and you can rearrange the order of the tasks.



â±ï¸ Recommended for times like these


You can review comments in a list format, a feature unique to this plugin. Furthermore, you can create tasks from these comments.


Please take advantage of this plugin to improve your work efficiency and create creative pieces. Feedback Flow is the sixth installment in the Plugin #100 Series provided by the deskwork brand 'NERY'!



ðŸ“ Please give us your feedback on the plugin features.


https://forms.gle/uikQFTa4TeX94nBp9



ðŸ’¼ What is NERY?


NERY is a deskwork brand that develops and provides plugins for Figma and Chrome.



ðŸš€ What is the Plugin #100 Series?


The Plugin #100 Series is a project to release 100 plugins for Figma and Google Chrome users.


In this project, we will develop plugins that meet the needs of creators and support them to make design work more convenient and efficient.


We will not perform all the planning and development of the project, but by showing you the intermediate stages and receiving feedback, we will continue to improve the functionality of the plugins and develop new products.


Your feedback will be reflected in the development of the plugin, so we ask for your support to realize a more user-friendly and attractive Figma and Chrome.



ðŸ¢ Developer


Ajike Co., Ltd.

https://ajike.co.jp/

ðŸ”Œ What kind of plugin is it?


Feedback Flow is a plugin that allows you to create a to-do list while reviewing comments on Figma.


When working on design with multiple people, you might find yourself exchanging information through comments. I'm sure everyone has experienced scenarios where they've had to make adjustments requested in comments, haven't they?

In such situations, this plugin allows you to create to-dos from these comments.

First, write down the to-dos from the comments, then proceed with making the required adjustments while viewing the to-do list. This way, you can ensure that no tasks are overlooked.



ðŸ”§ How to use


When you select 'Add to Task' from a comment, that comment gets added to your tasks. Within the task list, you can manage the status of tasks as completed or incomplete, and you can rearrange the order of the tasks.



â±ï¸ Recommended for times like these


You can review comments in a list format, a feature unique to this plugin. Furthermore, you can create tasks from these comments.


Please take advantage of this plugin to improve your work efficiency and create creative pieces. Feedback Flow is the sixth installment in the Plugin #100 Series provided by the deskwork brand 'NERY'!



ðŸ“ Please give us your feedback on the plugin features.


https://forms.gle/uikQFTa4TeX94nBp9



ðŸ’¼ What is NERY?


NERY is a deskwork brand that develops and provides plugins for Figma and Chrome.



ðŸš€ What is the Plugin #100 Series?


The Plugin #100 Series is a project to release 100 plugins for Figma and Google Chrome users.


In this project, we will develop plugins that meet the needs of creators and support them to make design work more convenient and efficient.


We will not perform all the planning and development of the project, but by showing you the intermediate stages and receiving feedback, we will continue to improve the functionality of the plugins and develop new products.


Your feedback will be reflected in the development of the plugin, so we ask for your support to realize a more user-friendly and attractive Figma and Chrome.

plugins.name: Variables to JSON Tokens for ZeroHeight
plugins.description:
This tool is made to respect the W3C Design Token formatting (draft) and be compatible with the Importing system of Zero Height.


The plugin has 2 commands:

  • Generating/Exporting the variales into a JSON file
  • Importing existing Tokens into Variables


The first one works, the second one is a proposition made by Figma in its demo file. I kept it but didn't improve/test it.


This plugin has been made for a personal use, but I hope it can be useful to you to. This plugin is not sponsored or supported (yet?) by the Zero Height company.

plugins.name: Accessible Color Picker
plugins.description:
Are you a designer who values accessibility and wants to ensure your designs are visually pleasing to all users? Look no further than Accessible Color Picker, a groundbreaking Figma plugin designed to revolutionize your color selection process. With its comprehensive features and user-friendly interface, this plugin will help you effortlessly achieve optimal color contrast ratios and create stunning designs that comply with WCAG 2.1 standards.

Let's delve into the remarkable features of Accessible Color Picker and discover how it can elevate your design workflow:

  1. Contrast Ratio Analysis: The plugin's first element provides instant feedback on the contrast ratio between two selected elements. It intuitively informs you whether the contrast meets the Target Contrast Ratio, allowing you to make informed decisions about color combinations. By ensuring your designs adhere to accessibility guidelines, you guarantee that users with visual impairments can comfortably read and engage with your content.
  2. Hex Color Code Adjustment: The second element of Accessible Color Picker takes color harmony to the next level. It presents a hex color code that shares the same hue and saturation as the foreground color but adjusts the lightness value precisely to align with the Target Contrast Ratio. This ingenious feature empowers you to effortlessly create color variations that not only look visually appealing but also maintain optimal accessibility standards.
  3. Live Color Simulation: Visualize your color choices in real-time with the third and fourth elements of the plugin. These elements display your selected foreground and background colors in actual context, allowing you to assess the readability and aesthetics of your design. Quickly iterate through different color combinations and find the perfect balance between style and accessibility.
  4. Customizable Target Contrast Ratio: Accessible Color Picker provides you with complete control over the Target Contrast Ratio. With the final component, an input field, you can easily adjust the ratio to meet the WCAG 2.1 guidelines defined by AA and AAA standards. Additionally, you can reduce the ratio to explore complementary color schemes and unlock a whole new world of design possibilities.

Why should you choose Accessible Color Picker for your Figma workflow? This plugin offers numerous benefits that will transform the way you design:

  • Enhance Accessibility: Ensure your designs are accessible to all users by effortlessly meeting WCAG 2.1 contrast ratio guidelines. Create inclusive experiences that prioritize readability and usability for everyone.
  • Streamline Color Selection: With real-time contrast ratio analysis and automatic hex color code adjustment, Accessible Color Picker simplifies the process of finding harmonious color combinations that meet accessibility standards.
  • Visualize Color Choices: Preview your color selections in context and fine-tune your designs until they achieve the perfect balance of aesthetics and readability. Save time and avoid costly revisions with this powerful visualization feature.
  • Unlock Design Possibilities: Experiment with different Target Contrast Ratios to explore complimentary color schemes and push the boundaries of your creativity. Accessible Color Picker opens up new avenues for unique and captivating design choices.

Don't compromise on accessibility or design excellence. Let Accessible Color Picker empower you to create visually stunning designs that leave no user behind. Add the plugin today and embark on a journey towards inclusive and captivating design experiences. Once added, simply launch the plugin and select any two Layers to get started!

plugins.name: Private Components
plugins.description:
Hide/Show all the private components in your file with one click.


In Design Systems adding a "_" or "." to the beginning of the name to hide components from libraries is a smart way to keep complex components separated from their smaller parts.

 

In some cases you'll also want to hide those secondary components from the design system user's eye so he doesn't get distracted with secondary information.

 

This plugin simply hides and shows all the private components for you.

plugins.name: Design System Visualizer

Seamlessly integrated within Figma, this powerful tool revolutionizes the way Backbase customers bring their brand identities to life in Backbase products.


Gone are the days of manual token creation and tedious color matching. With Design System Visualizer Plugin, designers can unlock a world of possibilities, transforming their brand's colors into tangible, customizable tokens with just a few clicks.

Just input your brand's primary and secondary colors, and Design System Visualizer Plugin generates a comprehensive set of tokens that effortlessly reflect your brand identity. plugins.name: Wonderflow
plugins.description:
Wonderflow organises your document into tidy numbered flows.


  • Choose frames to sort, and Wonderflow weaves its magic to organise, rename, and number them in an instant.
  • Drag and drop frames between any two frames for a quick switcheroo. Wonderflow will reorder the flow and update everything for you.
  • Tweak the spacing between flow frames and rows, and optionally align them all on the canvas, channeling your inner perfectionist.


You can update spacing and alignment without having to select any frames, but if you want to create a new flow or update the name of an existing flow, you will need to select the frames you want to affect.


See more details
plugins.tagline: Organise your documents into user flows

plugins.name: Fix Detached Instances
plugins.description:
Fix Detached Instances plugin helps you find and reattach detached instances. It lists all detached instances in the file and allows you to easily locate them. Reattach them to the original main component one by one or in bulk. Any changes you made to the detached instances would be preserved as overrides where possible. For more details check documentation. Support: gleb@dominate.design


â†’ Get unlimited license

Fix Detached Instances + Master plugin


Free trial allows you to attach 5 instances for free. This plugin goes hand in hand with Master plugin in the daily workflow so both plugins are purchased together as a bundle. Get Master license and enjoy unlimited usage of both plugins.


How to deal with detached instances

When you find a detached instance, there are two approaches you could take to bring your design back to consistency: restore the instance or extend the component. Using Master and Fix Detached Instances plugins you can choose which approach to take.


1. Reattach: use Fix Detached Instances plugin to restore the instance back to the original state without losing overrides. In order to preserve overrides, make sure the detached instance has the same layer order and hierarchy as the original main component.


2. Extend: find the detached instance using Fix Detached Instances and use Master â†’ New Component from Objects feature in order to create a new component from it. Then simply move the newly created component to the variant set together with the original component.


Support contact: gleb@dominate.design
plugins.tagline: Find and reattach detached instances without losing overrides

plugins.name: Figma to css and html by plantcss | Figma to code
plugins.description:
Description

Convert Figma design layers properties and values to HTML and CSS values for Frontend and Web UI Development. This plugin is developed from UI engineer perspective. This plugin main concept is reduce conversion time of convert Figma design to webpage development. So, this plugin is very useful for if your beginner or expert.


Features

  1. Support all text properties ( font-family, font-size, color and so on ) except transform values.
  2. Figma blend mode to CSS mix-blend-mode
  3. Export all type of Figma design gradient to CSS gradient values, It is also in the border.
  4. Different text properties in same line of text, it shows individual values to each.
  5. Figma filter blur and backdrop blur to CSS filter blur
  6. Figma drop and inner shadow to CSS box shadow
  7. Text border both solid and gradient colors convert to CSS.
  8. Plugin window resize option available. So, you can change the size plugin window size for a better work experience.
  9. Dark theme and Light theme support
  10. Quickly run the plugin with the help of shortcut plugin run button.


How to use plugin

  1. Just run the plugin
  2. After successfully plugin run, select any layer, you wish to convert.
  3. Selected design layer properties and values converted quickly and shown immediately.
  4. Select the code and copy values, to paste where you want.


Limitations

In case if some CSS properties not available for the current version, it will added future release versions. For a current version CSS codes only available, HTML code will be added later.


Drop your comment and share to other designer and developers.
plugins.tagline: Convert Figma design to css and html code for frontend development

-----------------------------------------------------------------------


This is an auxiliary tool for designers, with current features including:


  1. Sort Frames: Users can set vertical and horizontal spacing, and the plugin will sort and reposition all frames accordingly, ultimately achieving an orderly layout of frames from left to right and top to bottom. There is also an option to sort only selected frames, which is turned off by default.
  2. Rename Frames: The plugin renames frames based on their position on the page. For example, the first frame in the first row will be renamed '101_OriginalName', and the third frame in the second row will be renamed '203_OriginalName'.
  3. Global Font Replacement: By selecting a text layer, you can replace all fonts in the document that match the selected text layer's font (not limited to font size).


More practical tools will be added in the future, so stay tuned...

plugins.name: Explode Frames
plugins.description:
Detach all component instances and disable all auto layouts in a given selection.


Revert file to a setup closer to traditional design softwares for quick iterations, isolated studies and collaboration with non-designers.


Use with caution.

plugins.name: Bulk component instancer
plugins.description:
CSV Figma Component Instancer


This plugin creates multiple instances of a component with varying properties, driven by a simple CSV file whose rows define the properties of each instance.


Watch a demo:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IlWcNTyAD8o


For example the following CSV file would create 10 instances of a component with two TEXT properties (prop1 and prop2) and one BOOLEAN property (prop3):


prop1,prop2,prop3
my text field value,prop 2 valA,TRUE
prop1 valB,,1
B,,
valD,,0
valE,val2,FALSE
,,
,,
,,
,,
Values above use default property,,1


This is especially useful for e.g. creating tables, where you define a table row as a component with properties for the various text fields and optional boolean-displayed portions of each row.


Limitations:


  • Only TEXT and BOOLEAN property types are supported
plugins.tagline: Create multiple instances of a component with varying properties, driven by a simple CSV file
